paper_abstract: In this article a method to extract the conversion matrix of a nonlinear circuit by commercial CAD simulators is proposed. As an example, the conversion matrix, computed from a harmonic balance simulation, is used to control the stability of oscillators under large-signal conditions. This allows the suppression of possible spurious frequencies or the intentional generation of spurious signals (e.g. at subharmonic Frequency). 0 2010 Wiley Periodicals. Inc Int J RF and Microwave CAE 20 313-320, 2010
paper_title: Conversion Matrix Extraction by Commercial CAD Software for the Stability Design of Autonomous Circuits
